intro: Willoughbya laxa, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense, globular inflorescences. The plant has smooth, grey-green leaves that are simple and alternate along the stem. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in coastal and sandy regions. Willoughbya laxa is a popular ornamental plant due to its showy appearance and hardy nature.
